page.title: 07INDUSTRY
page.content: While remnants of traditional industries; agriculture and textiles; remain, the overall picture of the area reflects Britain since the Industrial Revolution. Essentially, Stapleford, Bramcote and Chilwell are now dormitory areas so industry is minimal and services; shopping and leisure; are predominate and house building commands most of the land that becomes available. The population and housing in Stapleford has been influenced by heavy industry; Railways, Stanton Iron Works and motor car components. As these industries have declined, and now provide fewer jobs, unemployement has risen and the population has sought work elsewhere. In this area, attempts are being made to provide new,light industries, especially in the electronics field.
